text: is the fifth morning since russia
invaded ukraine and if we just bring up
the map here this is the overall picture
on the ground you can see how ukraine
has been attacked from the north the
east and the south and russia has gained
some territories now overnight there
were air raid sirens in kiev and also
in kharkiv but the early indications
from kieva that has not been heavily
struck overnight the curfew that has
been in place for more than 24 hours is
now over people can go outside and buy
groceries and perhaps ominously russia
has said that there is now a safe route
out of the city leading down uh to the
south west now turning to kharkiv which
is the second biggest city you may
remember around this time yesterday we
were reporting about an incursion these
are the russian military vehicles moving
into kharkiv that appears to have been
repelled this is the aftermath the
damaged vehicles the ukrainian
military there so we believe that
kharkiv is now back under ukrainian
control though there were reports of
fighting and shelling there overnight
and into this morning now in a phone
call with boris johnson last night
ukraine's president vladimir zelinski is
reported to have said that the next 24
hours would be critical and part of the
reason why he might have said that is
down to these satellite images now the
line that you can see here that is a
three mile long line of russian tanks
and military hardware about 30 or 40
kilometers north of kiev quite possibly
preparing for a ground assault now
obviously when you have a lot of
vehicles on the ground like that they
are exposed uh to air attack and
yesterday uh this was posted by the
ukrainian ministry of defense it's a
video from a drone and it shows a strike
our russian convoy quite possibly the
same one that we saw uh in the satellite
pictures there it is a reminder of how
important it's going to be for ukraine
not to give control of the sky uh to the
russians it's important that they still
uh are up there in that space trying to
keep an eye and and and attack uh
russian targets if possible now
going back to this if we look at if we
look at the map that the key movements
that have taken place over the last 24
hours in terms of territory have been in
the south this is the the russian troops
that have moved up north from crimea uh
towards uh mariopol towards the east
there now yesterday evening we heard
that they had taken the town of berdansk
it's a port town population of about a
hundred thousand people and we are
believed they are now moving on mario
paul which is an even bigger city on the
sea as azov so quite possibly in the
next 24 hours or so we could see mario
pole uh surrounded and we could see that
the russian forces that are based in
eastern ukraine here in the donbass area
link up with the with the troops and the
tanks that have come uh from crimea now
today they are there are supposed to be
talks peace talks taking place this is a
picture that was posted by the uh
belarus ministry of foreign affairs uh
of a room in a in a town called jomel
not far from the uh ukrainian border in
belarus you can see the flags of russia
the flag of ukraine there it is set up
for a meeting between uh both countries
we will have to see what actually
happens certainly expectations not high
for some sort of break breakthrough
given what is happening on the ground at
the moment
